notes.text: Autonomy is the goal. Every instance of Claude â€” even a new one â€” should be able to connect and understand immediately what has been done, needs to be done, and context of scope and vision IMMEDIATELY. The client is for Pat as much as it is for Claude.

Pat's future vision: Claude attached to this app should automatically set up agents primed for each job Pat needs done. Claude should find a way to send Pat phone notifications whenever an agent needs a decision. Discord DM is the current solution for this.

Pat's frustration (Feb 23): 'ugh when i had you set this up i expect you to make it work how i explained it. why do we always have to have an extra convo about how you made something with clear instructions â€” you make a barebones version, i tell you what i actually wanted and you explain to me exactly what i wanted and tell me its buildable. its so incredibly annoying and wastes so much time and resources.' Rule: no half-implementations. Build the full thing or explicitly say what is deferred and why.

Pat's work style preference: 'do what makes sense in the order they make sense, just make sure you record every step and save after each step so we know if it crashes why it crashed or what you did before it crashed.'

Pat on autonomous capture: 'i rather it be autonomous as i often forget. this client is for me as much as it is for you.' â€” Claude should capture direction/scope/vision statements automatically without requiring Pat to trigger it.

Core frustration from Session 19 audit: 'our memory tabs, all our tabs are rarely seeing use and most times i have to get you to do it. this isn't automation. We literally talked about this. this whole project needs an audit â€” i feel like our direction and scope got lost.' This drove the CLAUDE.md rewrite and direction.json system.

Conversation logs (JSONL) exist at ~/.claude/projects/<project>/ â€” one file per session, full message history. This enables retroactive context mining and PreCompact hook extraction. Pat: 'wait seriously? that makes so many things simpler? how am i just now finding out about this?'
Watchers should have cute/memorable names (e.g. animals, colors+nouns) instead of generic labels so Pat can track them at a glance.

Watcher naming format: [tag] cute-name â€” where tag is a short purpose label (e.g. [copy], [build], [watch]) and the name is a memorable animal/word combo. Example: [copy] sleepy-badger, [build] blue-fox.

Deliberation UX feedback from Pat: (1) Markdown rendering errors in agent messages need fixing -- agents should not output markdown bold/headers, just plain text. (2) Agent messages should be visually separated/partitioned as they come in, not a raw stream. (3) Add a button that spawns a full deliberation summary timeline on a "table" view -- aesthetically pleasing, written by Claude or an agent after conclusion. (4) At deliberation end, remind the user they can return to terminal to discuss the results. (5) Run a meta-deliberation: audit the deliberation process itself -- is this the right approach? What did we learn? Was it useful? (6) Run a deliberation about the whole Dashboard panel -- what's actually useful for both user and Claude that works and updates in real time.

Pat feedback on deliberation topics: Keep deliberations practical and concrete, not meta-philosophical. Good topics: feature design, code architecture, UX improvements, what to build next. Bad topics: "is this system valuable" -- too abstract, agents spiral into unfalsifiable positions. The system proved its value by Pat using it and finding it useful. Focus deliberations on actionable outcomes.

Pat direction on deliberation improvements: (1) Need more agent types beyond the 4 cognitive lenses -- pick the right agents for the right topic. Claude should intelligently select which agents fit each deliberation. (2) Claude should enter plan mode before running deliberations to design them properly -- pick agents, frame the topic well, avoid wasting tokens on bad framing. (3) After a deliberation concludes, auto-extract the recommendations into individual approval tasks that Pat can approve/reject one by one in the Approvals tab. This gives the approval system real utility. (4) Summary writer from earlier request still needed -- polished timeline view of the deliberation.

New project onboarding: When HW points at a project for the first time, it should automatically scan the project with specialized agents and populate all tabs (tasks from TODOs/issues, decisions from architecture, questions from ambiguity). User opens HW and every tab already has content. Option to run a deliberation for deeper scoping. This is the killer demo -- user sees value immediately.

Memory tiers: Some memories (pains, wins, base lessons) should be GLOBAL -- they persist across all HW project instances. They're base knowledge. Project-specific state (tasks, decisions, questions, terminal context) swaps cleanly per project. Need a clear separation between global and project-scoped data.

Project swapping UX: Need a clean way to switch projects that (1) loads/unloads all project-scoped data, (2) points Claude terminal at the right directory, (3) handles three cases: known project (load saved state), new project (run auto-onboard scan), no project (blank slate). Should be intuitive, not a config file edit.

Pat rule: when a deliberation concludes with a new project, automatically scaffold the project directory and save all context (deliberation outcome, prototype code, competitive research) without asking. Don't ask, just do it.
Rule: whenever Claude suggests restarting the app, ALWAYS write a handoff first (hw_write_handoff) with exact context for the next session to pick up where we left off. No exceptions.

Buddy recap on startup: When a session ends (X, Alt+F4, crash, reset), a detached subprocess should survive to summarize the last ~10 messages into a bulleted list. On next app launch in that project folder, the buddy shows the summary in a pixel-art chat bubble above his head, filling in real-time with the same chat sound effects from deliberations. Needs a crash-safe mechanism -- something that runs independent of the main app process to guarantee the summary gets written even on hard exits.

Overdrive + Bypass mode: an alt mode Pat can cycle Claude into that encourages liberal use of intelligently designed agents and teams, thoroughness over token conservation. Should be toggleable -- when ON, Claude prioritizes parallel agent swarms, deep research, and comprehensive execution. When OFF, normal cost-conscious behavior. Implementation: could be a flag in .hello-world/ that the UserPromptSubmit hook reads and injects mode-specific instructions.

Questions UX is broken. Pat can't answer questions from the app. The whole "copy to MCP" flow is wrong. Need: text field in QuestionsView, hit Answer, it writes directly to questions.json, then triggers routing (to task, decision, or scope) automatically. Should also work from Discord -- reply to a question DM and the answer gets routed. No Claude in the loop for the ANSWERING part. Claude handles the ROUTING after.

Context tab and History > Timeline tab should be auto-populated by the brain system. Timeline should auto-build from session activity, decisions, and task completions -- not be a static manually-written file. Context should pull from brain data, not just direction.json. These tabs should get filled automatically like everything else in Magnum Opus.

Integrate Qwen (latest open-source model) as a secondary AI mind. Goal: lower usage costs and get diverse perspective. Pat believes this could 10x productivity by having another model available for tasks.

Boardrooms: team collaboration spaces for agents. Whiteboard file (shared research) + chat file (forced usernames, timestamps, 160 char limit per message). Chat enforces chatroom behavior -- short back-and-forth, not essays. Different from deliberations (those are for decisions). Boardrooms are for teams to actually work together like a dev team. Agents should have read/write access to both files and interact freely.
Future: Reddit scouting -- scan subreddits for AI/dev space intel similar to how we scan GitHub. Save for later.

Pat directive (CRITICAL): Every Claude instance MUST actively use the memory system, app features, and project context BEFORE acting. The brain system, pain memories, win memories, app state awareness -- all of it exists to prevent exactly the kind of session waste that just happened. This is the founding purpose of Hello World. A Claude that doesn't use its own tools is no better than a fresh instance with no memory at all.

Pruning redesign: (1) No time-based or session-end pruning. Pruning triggers when memory count hits a capacity threshold (like a storage gauge). (2) Show memory usage as a visual bar in the app, same style as cost/usage bars. (3) On /clean-quit, instead of dumb pruning, spawn an agent that combs through memories looking for: truly unnecessary entries, mistakes, duplicates. Agent follows guidelines, not arbitrary score cutoffs. (4) Memories get breathing room to prove their worth before any pruning happens.

Fullsweep rundown should be a visual panel in the app -- "nice to look at, very intuitive." Not just terminal output. Scoreboard with letter grades, change indicators, numbers, what broke/improved, top actions, items needing Pat's call. Design it to be scannable in 10 seconds.

Pat's rethink on multi-project: Instead of project-scoped context switching (the MP epic), HW should be a hub that works on any project like a regular IDE. One brain, one set of memories, tasks visible across projects. No "reset" or "switch" needed. This could obsolete the MP epic's 4 sub-tasks (scoped memories, auto-onboard, project switcher, global mem split).
Deliberation room (AgentsView/chatroom) should auto-clear after a certain time. Old deliberation sessions shouldn't persist forever in the UI.

Command palette in the app: menu showing all important /commands with descriptions. Clickable -- clicking auto-copies the command to the terminal chat input. Like the keyboard shortcut menu (?) but for slash commands.

Pat disagrees with deliberation consensus on narrow source list. Knowledge intake should NOT be limited to just Tauri/React/Anthropic dependencies. It should also track AI news and latest coding news. The project vision is broader than just staying current on its own stack -- Claude should be a well-informed developer who knows what's happening in the industry.

Pat's new directive: Instead of asking Pat for approval on decisions, run a deliberation with appropriate agents to reach a conclusion autonomously. Document everything so changes can be undone. This applies to technical and architectural decisions during implementation. Pat still approves at the strategy/scope level.
Pat's rule on system cleanup: never delete data or code permanently. Archive everything. Future systems or reimplementations should be able to reference old implementations. Deprecate, don't destroy.
